data.what_is:
Made for companies that sell, service, and support technology, ConnectWise PSA (formerly ConnectWise Manage) is the leading business management platform worldwide. Technology Solution Providers (TSPs) rely on ConnectWise PSA to achieve greater accountability, operational efficiency, and profitability. Leveraging the cloud, ConnectWise PSA facilitates business-process automation, help desk management and customer service, sales, marketing, project management, and business analytics that dramatically streamline a company's operations.

ConnectWise PSA is the centralized hub that gives TSPs an end-to-end view and total control over their business.

ConnectWise PSA also gives its users access to a powerful network of ideas, experts, and solutions. A veteran in the technology services industry, ConnectWise PSA has been the premier business management platform for technology companies for more than 15 years.
data.product_description: Business Automation and ConnectWise PSA (formerly ConnectWise Manage)

features.name: Customization
features.content: Allows administrators to customize to accomodate their unique processes.  Includes ability to create custom objects, fields, rules, calculations, and views. This feature was mentioned in 64 ConnectWise PSA reviews.

features.name: Workflow Capability
features.content: Automates a process that requires a series of steps that typically require intervention by a several different users.  Administrators can write rules to determine who and when a user needs to complete a step.  Also includes notification of users when they need to take action. 69 reviewers of ConnectWise PSA have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: User, Role, and Access Management
features.content: Based on 70 ConnectWise PSA reviews. Grant access to select data, features, objects, etc. based on the users, user role, groups, etc.

features.name: Internationalization
features.content: Enables users to view and transact business with the same content in multiple languages and currencies. This feature was mentioned in 38 ConnectWise PSA reviews.

features.name: Sandbox / Test Environments
features.content: As reported in 40 ConnectWise PSA reviews. Allows administrators to easily develop and test changes to the CRM deployment.  After changes are made admins can easily migrate the changes into the "live" or "production" environment.

features.name: Document & Content Mgmt.
features.content: Allows consuming, publishing and editing content from a central interface.  Content management for CRM systems might include presentations, documents, images and other related electronic files. This feature was mentioned in 59 ConnectWise PSA reviews.

features.name: Performance and Reliability
features.content: Based on 68 ConnectWise PSA reviews. Software is consistently available (uptime) and allows users to complete tasks quickly because they are not waiting for the software to respond to an action they took.

features.name: Output Document Generation
features.content: Based on 62 ConnectWise PSA reviews. Allows adminstrators to create templates that enable users to quickly generate dynamic documents in various formats based on the data stored in the application.

features.name: Contact & Account Management
features.content: Based on 122 ConnectWise PSA reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Store and retrieve information associated to customer contacts and accounts.  Track company-wide communication and information about contacts and accounts.

features.content: Based on 110 ConnectWise PSA reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Manage sales opportunities through their lifecycle from lead to order. Track stages, values, and probabilities of close.  Manage sales pipelines by individual sales rep, team, region, and company-wide.

features.name: Product & Price List Management
features.content: Based on 99 ConnectWise PSA reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Enter product/part numbers and manage the prices associated with them.  Typically functionality allows users to add products and prices to opportunities and quotes if these modules are provided within the same system.

features.name: Quote & Order Management
features.content: Based on 99 ConnectWise PSA reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Allows users to create a quote to be provided to a customer that contain at least products, prices and associated discounts.  Order management allows users to process orders that contain products, prices and associated discounts.

The lead process typically involves steps such as:  1. Lead Generation, 2. Customer Inquiry, Inquiry Capture, Lead Filtering, Lead Grading, Lead Distribution and Lead Qualification.

Create and optimize program assets such as landing pages, emails, campaigns, and lists. Track program objectives, results, and costs to assess the program ROI.

features.name: Social Media Engagement
features.content: Social apps including polls, sweepstakes, and referral programs can enhance audience engagement.  Include these on your website, landing pages, Facebook pages, and emails.

features.name: Social Media Advertising
features.content: Amplify brand and community stories; Reach customers by social profile and activity; Optimize social ad campaigns in real-time

initial_reviews.review_title: Great all around IT PSA all-in-one System
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
I have been using ConnectWise PSA (Manage) for over 10 years. The best part of this system is it's an all-in-one world for my service team, where all work is catalogued and organized while simultaneously keeping our customers in sync with the state of their Help Desk issue. The fact intergrates with RMM tools, report visualization tools, and documentation systems makes it the perfect 'source' for our daily work.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
The project management feature isn't great but I do see strides in rectifying that (which will require a complete replacement) in the last 6 months.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
ConnectWise PSA connects my on-site and remote teams with my clients. We don't email our clients outside of the ticketing system, all commmunication and the behind the scenes work is done within a single pane of glass, allowing each member of my team to pick up from where the last one has left off. It allows my team to self-manage in that they keep themselves accountable to each of us, so I can manage large teams efficiently.

initial_reviews.review_title: An amazing Professional Services Automation software
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
Is the main software we use in our company, where we manage everything. It has been very easy to use, and we use it every day, all the time with a lot of features. In my case, we always use to manage our tickets and provide an excellent on time customer support service

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
Nothing to complaint about. 100% recommended

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
Is our main platform as a CRM, we can provide on time and organized technical support to our customers. As well as the user for out Billing Department, our Sales department and Marketing Department.

initial_reviews.review_title: Outdated, Archaic, Horrible
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
Nothing. there is nothing good about Connectwise PSA.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
The product hasn't been properly updated since it was created. The UI is horrible. Service nonexistent. The "university" is a joke that teaches you nothing about how to actually use the product. The product itself is the most unintuitive pile of code to ever disgrace the internet.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
We need a ticketing system to function. I suppose it solves that, but there are other solutions that I want to switch to because Connectwise is hot garbage.

initial_reviews.review_title: Bundled with several features and integrations to make life easy for support professionals
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
- Enables seamless coordination between different departments as the necessary information for a particular order is visible to the different departments

- Fast desktop application

- Integrations with applications like Outlook, Zapier etc.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
-Delay or Slow processing of screens for desktop application observed if a high res image is added to the Notes section.Also, in my case ticket became inaccessible due to the same reason.

- Dependant on external applications for searching a ticket using a keyword present in the Notes section. This leads to frustration during a performance audit where more than 100 tickets must be parsed and filtered using a particular keyword as the particular ticket number is not available.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our organization is using ConnectWise to manage the customer data and actions performed for the different issues on the units shipped to them. The volume of tickets being created and stored are relatively large and we have not faced any struggles w.r.t to performance apart from rare glitches.
However, the software has a bad UI experience and therefore, needs an overhaul. Also, AI is not incorporated to assist in strategic decisions.

initial_reviews.review_title: ConnectWise helps me to organise and structure what I do
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
I bought ConnectWise PSA so that I could better manage the invoicing of products such as Microsoft 365 and web hosting services that I provide to clients.
Through their thorough onboarding service I have discovered many more features that help me organise my work and ensure that working time is recognised and charged for more accurately.
Customer support is excellent.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
ConnectWise PSA does not integrate with my accounting system (Free Agent) or automated invoicing and payment. The latter is available in the USA but not in the UK.
The system is expensive for a one-man business like mine.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
It helps me to keep track of customer requests and the time I spend on these. It also helps me to keep track of customers' systems and licences.

The system is expensive for a one-man business like mine.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: It helps me to keep track of customer requests and the time I spend on these. It also helps me to keep track of customers' systems and licences.

initial_reviews.review_title: Our ConnectWise Experience
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
- Ease of ability to create recurring service appointments

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
-	Workflows run on a 10-minute timer rather than constantly.
-	Ticket templates can only be applied after creating tickets.
-	Opportunity templates don't exist.
-	No way to standardize note creation that impact status and email CC.
-	No way to standardize time entry creation using templates that impact status and email CC.
-	Client's e-mail address does not appear on opportunities.
-	No way to add in-line pictures to opportunities. Only downloadable attachments.
-	No way to add multiple resources to an opportunity's activities.
-	No standard approval function for approve and post process.
-	No notify resource option for individual notes.
-	No way to edit schedule entry descriptions.
-	No way to add multiple tickets to a service call.
-	No way to bookmark or favorite a client.
-	No way to edit items added by exchange.
-	No way to view a 5-day work week on the calendar.
-	No way to add opportunity pods.
-	Ticket automation regarding changing boards doesn't allow for simply changing boards and keeping other settings on the ticket, such as status and work type.
-	Services and products do not group under one invoice without creating an additional invoice.
-	To give a discount you must create a line item specifically for this.
-	Default billable rates changes when board changes.
-	Can't add more teams to the Dispatch Calendar list. (known issue)
-	Agreements and time/tickets can't be invoiced together.
-	No support for browser based predictive text.
-	Changes to items do not retroactively change contracts.
-	Pro-ration of contracts is flawed and labor intensive.
-	Dispatch Portal does not remember previously used sorting method.
-	Can't use stopwatch without requiring a resource to be added or time entry to be prompted.
-	Can't resize pods in opportunities.
-	Can't transfer POs to Quickbooks.
-	Can't see the email the customer receives for ticket open/close. #01411633
-	Searching for companies in the global search bar at the top of the page doesn't work. #01386759 ISSUE-418
-	No single pane of glass to easily see other tech's tickets.
-	No single pane of glass to easily see other tech's hours.
-	No single pane of glass to easily see other tech's upcoming time off requests.
-	No single pane of glass to see tickets in the queues.
-	Team customization doesn't work in Calendar to add more than 5.
-	Signature doesn't show the pictures in the signature. #01401431
-	Can't do invoice transfer to QB from the web app.
-	No good way to do time off requests or schedule adjustment requests.
-	No way to show on the calendar that a service call is complete without removing the resource from the ticket.
-	Exchange calendar sync doesn't consistently work (known issue) #01374600
-	It takes several days to get a license added for a new employee.
-	Can't filter or sort opportunities by creator.
-	Can't show ticket creator on e-mail notifications.
-	Can't add secondary contacts to tickets.
-	Less granular integration with Quickbooks for income types.
-	Only two simultaneous sessions.
-	Contacts default to show active & inactive, can't change to just active.
-	Temporary contract discounts require manual changes upon date of change.
-	POs don't note customers on ordered items.
-	Different areas can't use the same variable for views (ie, ticket owner, territory).
-	Unique pop-up message clients on company page or a ticket aren't easily added.
-	Can't customize which fields are required at ticket creation based on board.
-	You can't add config items during ticket creation, you must save first.
-	Can't tell which contact created an email or Client Portal ticket.
-	Automate endpoints can't be mapped to different additions on an agreement.
-	Have to enter each ticket during approve and post to see relevant information.
-	Brightguage doesn't sync immediately
-	Can't quickly and easily see who created an opportunity
-	Approve and post method messes up the resolved SLA
-	Can't directly view PDFs on opportunities without downloading first
-	Can't assign more than one person to an activity on an Opportunity

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are attempting to use ConnectWise PSA as a single pane of glass for service delivery.

initial_reviews.review_title: Reasons why we use ConnectWise PSA over AutoTask
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
I like their ConnectWise Manage client software over using the web version of it. Imagine you are trying a well-detailed note, accidentally hitting the refresh button, and everything you have been typing is gone in a flash. But with the CWM client, whatever you are typing will remain unharmed even if you refresh.

The interface might not look colorful to you, but it gets the job done very well. That's all that matters to me.

I have used AutoTask, and I know the pain when this happens.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
ConnectWise PSA might not be fully compatible with all of their platforms for someone heavily dependent on Kaseya-owned platforms.

They have API integration through.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our engineers love moving between the tabs to access specific details with the CW PSA desktop client version.
For example, while working on a ticket, They can check configuration items, contacts, templates, etc..

If you don't use a service like ITGlue, you can still use CW PSA to record information about client assets and other information. If you use ITGlue, you can easily integrate CW with IT Glue and reach new levels.

initial_reviews.review_title: Solid service, many features, not the greatest UI
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
What I like best is that its pretty reliable in terms of uptime, at least for cloud hosted. I do like that there is some configuration settings to help you fine tune to your needs, but I do wish it had more configuration options.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
Reports, this is probably the worst part. The stock reports are very limited on data points that you can filter and fine tune. I often have to run 2-3 reports in a category I'm interested in, then export to excel to sort and view the data the way I need.
They do have report writer, but its meant for someone with a developer skill set, not a low code option.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are an MSP and needed a solution for managing customers, agreements, support tickets, hardware, invoicing. It has made us more productive by being able to manage the previously mentioned tasks in a more streamlined manner.

initial_reviews.review_title: ConnectWise PSA was mediocre at best
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
ConnectWise PSA was the first ticketing system we elected to use when starting our MSP. We found the entry price point to be fair, but the overall feature set to be lacking.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
It was lacking key integrations we wanted. The overall flow of using the ticketing system was lack luster and created workflow challenges for myself and the team.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
We found the ticketing system portion of ConnectWise PSA to be furstrating and lacking in features that would help with overall ease of use and day to day workflows. We've not used it for about 1.5-2 years now, so I cannot say what changes may have been made since then.

initial_reviews.review_title: Complete tool for your manage IT needs
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
The system has something for everyone. Meaning that each role within the company finds value within the system. All of our ticketing, VCIO management, billing, agreements, opportunities, etc. go through ConnectWise. It integrates with almost all of our tools stack that helps manage GP of agreements.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
Support has been good and bad. When you have a support person on the phone and they can resolve your problem - you're golden. If they have to escalate, I don't feel like they try to get back to you. We schedule tickets with our customers and I would like to do the same with my vendor.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
Instead of having everyone work in separate systems, we all work in one system and an opportunity won is converted, made into a project, and update the agreement. This is done by each person doing their job function and not having to reinput information from another source. It is all done within ConnectWise and can be traced backwards and forwards.

all_reviews.review_title: Great all around IT PSA all-in-one System
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
I have been using ConnectWise PSA (Manage) for over 10 years. The best part of this system is it's an all-in-one world for my service team, where all work is catalogued and organized while simultaneously keeping our customers in sync with the state of their Help Desk issue. The fact intergrates with RMM tools, report visualization tools, and documentation systems makes it the perfect 'source' for our daily work.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
The project management feature isn't great but I do see strides in rectifying that (which will require a complete replacement) in the last 6 months.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
ConnectWise PSA connects my on-site and remote teams with my clients. We don't email our clients outside of the ticketing system, all commmunication and the behind the scenes work is done within a single pane of glass, allowing each member of my team to pick up from where the last one has left off. It allows my team to self-manage in that they keep themselves accountable to each of us, so I can manage large teams efficiently.

Is the main software we use in our company, where we manage everything. It has been very easy to use, and we use it every day, all the time with a lot of features. In my case, we always use to manage our tickets and provide an excellent on time customer support service

Nothing. there is nothing good about Connectwise PSA.

The product hasn't been properly updated since it was created. The UI is horrible. Service nonexistent. The "university" is a joke that teaches you nothing about how to actually use the product. The product itself is the most unintuitive pile of code to ever disgrace the internet.

all_reviews.review_title: Bundled with several features and integrations to make life easy for support professionals
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
- Enables seamless coordination between different departments as the necessary information for a particular order is visible to the different departments

- Fast desktop application

- Integrations with applications like Outlook, Zapier etc.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
-Delay or Slow processing of screens for desktop application observed if a high res image is added to the Notes section.Also, in my case ticket became inaccessible due to the same reason.

- Dependant on external applications for searching a ticket using a keyword present in the Notes section. This leads to frustration during a performance audit where more than 100 tickets must be parsed and filtered using a particular keyword as the particular ticket number is not available.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our organization is using ConnectWise to manage the customer data and actions performed for the different issues on the units shipped to them. The volume of tickets being created and stored are relatively large and we have not faced any struggles w.r.t to performance apart from rare glitches.
However, the software has a bad UI experience and therefore, needs an overhaul. Also, AI is not incorporated to assist in strategic decisions.

all_reviews.review_title: ConnectWise helps me to organise and structure what I do
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
I bought ConnectWise PSA so that I could better manage the invoicing of products such as Microsoft 365 and web hosting services that I provide to clients.
Through their thorough onboarding service I have discovered many more features that help me organise my work and ensure that working time is recognised and charged for more accurately.
Customer support is excellent.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
ConnectWise PSA does not integrate with my accounting system (Free Agent) or automated invoicing and payment. The latter is available in the USA but not in the UK.
The system is expensive for a one-man business like mine.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
It helps me to keep track of customer requests and the time I spend on these. It also helps me to keep track of customers' systems and licences.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
- Ease of ability to create recurring service appointments

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
-	Workflows run on a 10-minute timer rather than constantly.
-	Ticket templates can only be applied after creating tickets.
-	Opportunity templates don't exist.
-	No way to standardize note creation that impact status and email CC.
-	No way to standardize time entry creation using templates that impact status and email CC.
-	Client's e-mail address does not appear on opportunities.
-	No way to add in-line pictures to opportunities. Only downloadable attachments.
-	No way to add multiple resources to an opportunity's activities.
-	No standard approval function for approve and post process.
-	No notify resource option for individual notes.
-	No way to edit schedule entry descriptions.
-	No way to add multiple tickets to a service call.
-	No way to bookmark or favorite a client.
-	No way to edit items added by exchange.
-	No way to view a 5-day work week on the calendar.
-	No way to add opportunity pods.
-	Ticket automation regarding changing boards doesn't allow for simply changing boards and keeping other settings on the ticket, such as status and work type.
-	Services and products do not group under one invoice without creating an additional invoice.
-	To give a discount you must create a line item specifically for this.
-	Default billable rates changes when board changes.
-	Can't add more teams to the Dispatch Calendar list. (known issue)
-	Agreements and time/tickets can't be invoiced together.
-	No support for browser based predictive text.
-	Changes to items do not retroactively change contracts.
-	Pro-ration of contracts is flawed and labor intensive.
-	Dispatch Portal does not remember previously used sorting method.
-	Can't use stopwatch without requiring a resource to be added or time entry to be prompted.
-	Can't resize pods in opportunities.
-	Can't transfer POs to Quickbooks.
-	Can't see the email the customer receives for ticket open/close. #01411633
-	Searching for companies in the global search bar at the top of the page doesn't work. #01386759 ISSUE-418
-	No single pane of glass to easily see other tech's tickets.
-	No single pane of glass to easily see other tech's hours.
-	No single pane of glass to easily see other tech's upcoming time off requests.
-	No single pane of glass to see tickets in the queues.
-	Team customization doesn't work in Calendar to add more than 5.
-	Signature doesn't show the pictures in the signature. #01401431
-	Can't do invoice transfer to QB from the web app.
-	No good way to do time off requests or schedule adjustment requests.
-	No way to show on the calendar that a service call is complete without removing the resource from the ticket.
-	Exchange calendar sync doesn't consistently work (known issue) #01374600
-	It takes several days to get a license added for a new employee.
-	Can't filter or sort opportunities by creator.
-	Can't show ticket creator on e-mail notifications.
-	Can't add secondary contacts to tickets.
-	Less granular integration with Quickbooks for income types.
-	Only two simultaneous sessions.
-	Contacts default to show active & inactive, can't change to just active.
-	Temporary contract discounts require manual changes upon date of change.
-	POs don't note customers on ordered items.
-	Different areas can't use the same variable for views (ie, ticket owner, territory).
-	Unique pop-up message clients on company page or a ticket aren't easily added.
-	Can't customize which fields are required at ticket creation based on board.
-	You can't add config items during ticket creation, you must save first.
-	Can't tell which contact created an email or Client Portal ticket.
-	Automate endpoints can't be mapped to different additions on an agreement.
-	Have to enter each ticket during approve and post to see relevant information.
-	Brightguage doesn't sync immediately
-	Can't quickly and easily see who created an opportunity
-	Approve and post method messes up the resolved SLA
-	Can't directly view PDFs on opportunities without downloading first
-	Can't assign more than one person to an activity on an Opportunity

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are attempting to use ConnectWise PSA as a single pane of glass for service delivery.

all_reviews.review_title: Reasons why we use ConnectWise PSA over AutoTask
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
I like their ConnectWise Manage client software over using the web version of it. Imagine you are trying a well-detailed note, accidentally hitting the refresh button, and everything you have been typing is gone in a flash. But with the CWM client, whatever you are typing will remain unharmed even if you refresh.

The interface might not look colorful to you, but it gets the job done very well. That's all that matters to me.

I have used AutoTask, and I know the pain when this happens.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
ConnectWise PSA might not be fully compatible with all of their platforms for someone heavily dependent on Kaseya-owned platforms.

They have API integration through.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our engineers love moving between the tabs to access specific details with the CW PSA desktop client version.
For example, while working on a ticket, They can check configuration items, contacts, templates, etc..

If you don't use a service like ITGlue, you can still use CW PSA to record information about client assets and other information. If you use ITGlue, you can easily integrate CW with IT Glue and reach new levels.

all_reviews.review_title: Solid service, many features, not the greatest UI
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
What I like best is that its pretty reliable in terms of uptime, at least for cloud hosted. I do like that there is some configuration settings to help you fine tune to your needs, but I do wish it had more configuration options.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
Reports, this is probably the worst part. The stock reports are very limited on data points that you can filter and fine tune. I often have to run 2-3 reports in a category I'm interested in, then export to excel to sort and view the data the way I need.
They do have report writer, but its meant for someone with a developer skill set, not a low code option.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are an MSP and needed a solution for managing customers, agreements, support tickets, hardware, invoicing. It has made us more productive by being able to manage the previously mentioned tasks in a more streamlined manner.

Reports, this is probably the worst part. The stock reports are very limited on data points that you can filter and fine tune. I often have to run 2-3 reports in a category I'm interested in, then export to excel to sort and view the data the way I need.

all_reviews.review_title: Complete tool for your manage IT needs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
The system has something for everyone. Meaning that each role within the company finds value within the system. All of our ticketing, VCIO management, billing, agreements, opportunities, etc. go through ConnectWise. It integrates with almost all of our tools stack that helps manage GP of agreements.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
Support has been good and bad. When you have a support person on the phone and they can resolve your problem - you're golden. If they have to escalate, I don't feel like they try to get back to you. We schedule tickets with our customers and I would like to do the same with my vendor.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
Instead of having everyone work in separate systems, we all work in one system and an opportunity won is converted, made into a project, and update the agreement. This is done by each person doing their job function and not having to reinput information from another source. It is all done within ConnectWise and can be traced backwards and forwards.

all_reviews.review_title: For ConnectWise, promises are made to be broken
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
ConnectWise is a mature product with a vast featureset.  If there is something you want to do with it, you can probably do it. Maybe not efficiently, but you can do it.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
The company is horrible, in all ways. At no time did we feel satisfied with the support, performance, workflow, and feature set. When it came down to it, all commitements in every way were ignored.  Pricing, support, and promised functionality.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
I wish ConnectWise helped us solve problems. While it provided some added automation functionality that we were in desperate need of, it added a level of necessary complexity and additional work that negated the value gained in the automation functionality. We moved away from ConnectWise after years of broken promises and an utter failure to actually provide support.

all_reviews.review_title: It is the best option for ticket management that you will find in the market
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
What we mainly like about the ConnectWise platform is that it has shown that it is constantly growing and growing through its updates; the venue has a support team that is dedicated daily to attending to every requirement of the audience, providing possible solutions as well as taking into account every observation to address and act on future updates, it has robust ticket management that allows us to maintain a better organization and on occasions that merit it to support our customers. One of the best things about the ConnectWise platform is its integration with the Outlook calendar.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
Honestly, very few things since the ConnectWise platform met and even exceeded the expectations we had initially; however, it becomes pretty uncomfortable that the issue of billing can only be done on the first of each month; before this update, we were able to go through this billing process daily helping and providing excellent support in that way to the management of the department that is responsible for this task.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
A super considerable improvement in the ticket management of our organization; with the ConnectWise platform, we can easily classify, search and manage all customers and all tickets, as well as save time thanks to the easy automation of management that it provides in other departments of our organization. Without a doubt, this platform significantly increased our productivity.

all_reviews.review_title: A helpful resource for managing our business wisely
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
From the beginning, ConnectWise PSA has been used to track our customer information in a detailed manner from various sources and formats; the way this software covers it is simply amazing. We have also started to take advantage of it for assigning daily tickets because its configuration is simple, and it is perfect to know the work that is needed in them; on the other hand, the position with timesheets is comfortable because it is pretty simple to manage them at the time of completing them, as well as at the time of approving them. I must say that it is great to have such a robust tool; it integrates many features that we can use in the same environment, and, being an online tool, it does not matter if we are in our office because we can access it from anywhere with internet access.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
It is not easy to configure, and its dashboard lacks customization options. This is the only not-so-positive thing I have found.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
ConnectWise PSA is perfect for support and sales work because of its ease and high effectiveness when managing tickets and working with timesheets. The system is very comfortable, and its clean user interface makes it easy to adapt to the software and allows us to work more efficiently. It has a variety of automation that help us save time and energy while providing an improved service and increasing our productivity. It is a product that I am happy with in my organization and would recommend.

I like that it is a constantly evolving tool, meaning it is continually improving. It has valuable CRM and ticket management capabilities that help us work in a more organized way and support our customers when the need arises; it makes working with customer service less of a nightmare. The product works well, so far, we have had no problems, and the Outlook calendar integration is perfect.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
Depending on the user's needs, there is some learning curve, and the support needs to be improved.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
It is a great ticketing system with sales qualities and integrations; it helps us address customer needs efficiently around the clock. The great thing is that the program itself is constantly improving and has good integration capabilities with third-party tools. The only thing that leaves a little to be desired is its support service; sometimes, it can be not so good. It is a tool that I would dare to recommend; it is flexible and integrates many features to manage tickets efficiently, provide proper customer support, and more. And it even works well with CRM.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?

all_reviews.review_title: Great for growth, but a huge learning curve in the beginning.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
ConnectWise Manage has options for every customization and setting you to require.  It is set up to integrate well with most other tools like Connect, or ITGlue.   From a support perspective, I really enjoyed setting up the portal for the end users to input tickets from.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
The learning curve is huge.  The implementation will take time, and needs to be set up 100% correctly.  Again from the support side of our business, there is a lot more hoops to jump through to get a ticket created, documented and closed compared to other ticketing systems

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
ConnectWise Manage has a lot of customization for our support team.  For me and my team, we use the ticketing feature the most.  It has a large learning curve but a lot of options which allows for expanding companies.    It connects time on site, with billing and inventory all in one area.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
Nice easy set-up, very easy to get used to using. Can be utilized in different ways for different types of businesses and support. Also ideal for different sizes of business, small or large.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
Updates to the application aren't always good. One update made it so you could no longer search for standard notes using an asterisk and a keyword in the template. We previously were able to categorize standard notes by team, for example, "Support - Device Termination" and you could search *termination to find it. The application also seems to get slower and slower with each update. Now, the Today page on the application loads about 10% of the time. The other 90% of the time, it stays loading endlessly.

Recommendations to others considering ConnectWise PSA:
Their support has not been very responsive to us so keep that in mind. The more in-depth you get with automations, the more you may need to rely on their assistance.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are providing support and support solutions to customers. We are able to bill them through ConnectWise with support hours and products that they purchase from us.

review_question_answers.answer: Updates to the application aren't always good. One update made it so you could no longer search for standard notes using an asterisk and a keyword in the template. We previously were able to categorize standard notes by team, for example, "Support - Device Termination" and you could search *termination to find it. The application also seems to get slower and slower with each update. Now, the Today page on the application loads about 10% of the time. The other 90% of the time, it stays loading endlessly.

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering ConnectWise PSA:
review_question_answers.answer: Their support has not been very responsive to us so keep that in mind. The more in-depth you get with automations, the more you may need to rely on their assistance.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: We are providing support and support solutions to customers. We are able to bill them through ConnectWise with support hours and products that they purchase from us.

all_reviews.review_title: Connectwise is the backbone of our company. If it's not in Connectwise, it didn't happen.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
We really like the on premise capabilty, running our own server, tied to our own SQL data.
Remember, on premise can be your own AWS instance or the likes.

For small and medium sized MSP's (Managed Service Providers) and Service Organizaitons,
that is between 4 and 40 technicians, Connectwise is a complete system.

If you are smaller, this may not be for you. Stick to the subscription model.
If you are really big, you may like the API's and customization here, but you may already have bigger software.

But, if you are the vast majority of business IT support, then this is the one.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
The software is based on the .NET platform, which is starting to show it's age.
The latest version did move to the newest .NET feature set, and works well with 365 now.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
It handles quoting and invoicing, time tracking and service billing, project management and management reporting.

Our customers love having a one page invoice, with 18 pages of time detail available behind it.

We use it to drive our incentive based pay model.
We use it to ensure a consistent onboarding experience for new clients.
We use it for the sales and marketing tracks and automated workflows.
We use it to keep things from falling through the cracks, like SSL renewal or UPS battery replacement in 3 years.

all_reviews.review_title: In short, anything else would have been better than this!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
This program was suggested to us as it c

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
This program was recommended to us by our accounting software as they have a connector that syncs the two platforms. During our sales call, this program seemed to be exactly what we were looking for. Once the paperwork was signed, this is when everything went sideways. The implementation is awful and does not set the program up for real use. Once you go live, you have little to no support. They have limits on everything, and if you want to exceed character counts on migration tickets, you will need to pay for it. Upload your current invoice template, pay extra; any one-on-one support, pay extra; everything is extra and the customer service team is not helpful and directs you to staff that also cannot help you. They will string you along for weeks, and you will get back a simple NO from "management". After countless hours and battles, I am only half set up (we signed in August, it's now April).

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
New helpdesk platform that migrates with our accounting software to put all actions in one software, but this is not correct, we are still using both and no support to help us.

What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
Ticket management is good. Ticket workflows allows automation which saves engineering time. Time and expense entry is simple and effective. Fat client, web and mobile connectivity enables staff to connect from anywhere.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
Ticket templating is lacking, you should be able to create a ticket via template, not just apply over existing. The customer portal needs a refresh.  SaaS version experiences delays compared to our previous on-prem deployment. Reporting could use some work.

Recommendations to others considering ConnectWise PSA:
Manage is a great product and constantly improving. Many vendors offer direct API integration, which can be very beneficial. It does, however, require lots of time and effort to configure and deploy out of the box. It might not be the best option for smaller companies that can't / won't dedicate this time. Customer support is not the greatest but they typically resolve most issues quickly.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
From client ticket management,  asset inventory, product renewals to tracking billable time, we wouldn't be able to service our clients without it!  Manage allowed us to combine multiple products into a single location which saves us time.

Partnering with Accounting Packages (SAGE Intacct specifically in our case) provides seamless transfer of information without requiring hands-on actions.  Sales knows when invoices are paid, accounting knows what invoices have gone out. all_reviews.review_title: Usable Service With Limited Ease Of Use
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
The ability to assign tasks and opportunities has been an instrumental piece for my company. With so many employees in different locations, we've been able to pass opportunities along to each other easily. In addition, you can send emails directly through ConnectWise either to the customer or to a team member. It is easy to track expenses as well as do quoting.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
It takes a while to load and navigate from page to page, and there isn't an easy way to pull information or do mass updates to specific accounts. It's out of date compared to many of its competitors, and some tasks to complete take far too many steps to do.

Recommendations to others considering ConnectWise PSA:
Take advantage of the courses they offer and the support that they show that can help you get the most out of all the features that they have available.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
Problems Solved:
- Office collaboration
- Administration of tasks and items
- One-stop shop to view lists of all accounts

Benefits:
- Reduced time passing along tasks or opportunities manually
- Track your accounts in one space
- More visibility behind leadup to purchases

all_reviews.review_title: A large player for MSP's, but stagnant development with atrocious support.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
It typically integrates with most MSP tools, and there is often a manual workflow or process you can set up for most items needed as an MSP, but that's the best I can say. Using ConnectWise daily is miserable.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
Where do I begin?
The most significant "feature release" in the last 18 months was the ability to add rich text and custom hyperlinks in an email! All development and features are completely stagnant.

When we experienced a significant security event, support was very slow and there is no ability to get someone on the phone. There is only chat support, and you usually have to explain the issue 3 times before someone *might* understand. When you email in a ticket on a somewhat urgent issue, you won't get a response for at least a week. They will ADD licenses and charge you immediately, but if the sales team makes a mistake and charges you for an extra license, it will take WEEKS to get the issue corrected, and you will be charged for an expensive license that entire time.

Loading the interface in the browser on a Mac is consistently slow. There is only a native app for PC.

Contact management is difficult. Updating/deleting/merging contacts takes at least 30 seconds-2 minutes per contact in the browser on Mac. You can only use the native PC app to upload a CSV of contacts to ConnectWise Manage, but that only gives you the ability to upload new contacts or create duplicate contacts. As far as I'm aware, there is not an option to use a CSV upload to over-write large contact updates. You have to do those manually in the browser and that is painfully slow.

With SSO implemented, half our team can't sign into the iOS mobile app reliably, so it's difficult and time-consuming to track time entries or find client contact information on the go.

ConnectWise Manage is similar to an operating system like Linux: you have to customize all setup yourself, create your own workflows and processes, and few things work "out of the box." You need to pay a hefty initial setup fee. Our initial setup was completed by a third-party consultant, which wasn't the most helpful. We later came to find that some of the instructions they gave us were wrong. To import data from Zendesk, we needed to hire an additional company, and that process also didn't work properly. After initial setup, you need to pay ConnectWise for anything more than a basic break/fix question. If you have questions about the most efficient path to set up a process or how to write any custom reports in their Report Writer module, you will need to pay hourly for their consulting, in addition to the already expensive monthly license cost.

The interface looks like it was designed in 2005.

Recommendations to others considering ConnectWise PSA:
Please seriously consider other products before purchasing ConnectWise Manage. If you are stuck using ConnectWise Manage and need to do reporting, use Brightgauge instead of the built-in Report Writer.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
It mostly meets our basic needs for processing MSP IT client tickets. We have been able to escalate tickets to Tier 2 internal agents for our clients and collaborate on tickets between teams. But there is no active development and limited options for innovative automation, and it's not a pleasant software to use daily.

The ability to create recurring Agreement invoices

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
- Product hasn't changed the UI in over 12 years that I have been using it.
- Since the sale of the business, their support is useless - completely useless.
- I called the Sydney number to escalate my issue ( a simple cancellation of agreement after 12 years of using it) and got a lady in India, who had some weird webcam chat making dinging noises going in the background, but affecting my ability to hear her over the noises.
- I spoke to my Account Manager in Sydney - and have had no escalation of support since last month.
-  More than 50 emails back and forth to try and cancel my agreement which has been in place since 2008, and it's STILL not finalized. (Ticket 13976061 for anyone at ConnectWise who cares)
- You would think that after 12 years of being loyal to their company, and growing my seat count, that they would accept my email in writing to cancel the service.  NO WAY!!  Since July Last year - the emails are all the same!!  "Sorry we tried to reach you but you didn't respond, we are closing the ticket" - HELLO!??  Nobody tried to call me, or even email back! Every email takes over 24 hours to get a reply back.
- If you're considering signing up to these clowns, seriously consider other options.  I would suggest any alternative to ConnectWise.

ConnectWise helps you to capture and bill every service request

all_reviews.review_title: Terrible customer service, buggy products with poor integration
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
If you have the most basic question to ask support bout, you may get what you're looking for out of their online support chatbot.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
This is by far the buggiest, most convoluted piece of software (let alone PSA) that I have ever used. The dashboard is completely useless. It doesn't refresh regularly, so you have to constantly go back to outlook to know whether you actually have an appointment. The other information is next to useless because there's no way to actually show service boards on it. If you want to find out if you have a ticket, you have to go looking for it. There are more Help links on it than useful widgets. And that's just the dashboard.
If you want to configure anything you have to go to service tables, not configurator screens AND, you have to know what you're looking for before you try and configure it.
Many of the default connectors don't work (out of the box) with anything other than MS Exchange of Office 365. You need to get a tech to help you through the configuration.
It's massively over-complicated for tasks that should be really simple and straightforward.
The contract has NO CLIENT termination language... BEWARE!!!

Recommendations to others considering ConnectWise PSA:
If you decide to go with ConnectWise, 100% make sure that you include a termination clause that allows you to terminate the contract at any time.  Before you sign anything, try at least two other PSA AFTER you try ConnectWise Manage.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were looking for an RMM product and an integrated PSA.  ConnectWise just happened to have both and they said it was "integrated" out of the box. Perhaps, we have different ideas of what being integrated actually means? We have spent more time dealing with product issues and customer service than implementing the product or, servicing our customers for that matter, which is sad.

It's massively over-complicated for tasks that should be really simple and straightforward.
The contract has NO CLIENT termination language... BEWARE!!!

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering ConnectWise PSA:
review_question_answers.answer: If you decide to go with ConnectWise, 100% make sure that you include a termination clause that allows you to terminate the contract at any time.  Before you sign anything, try at least two other PSA AFTER you try ConnectWise Manage.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: We were looking for an RMM product and an integrated PSA.  ConnectWise just happened to have both and they said it was "integrated" out of the box. Perhaps, we have different ideas of what being integrated actually means? We have spent more time dealing with product issues and customer service than implementing the product or, servicing our customers for that matter, which is sad.

all_reviews.review_title: Connectwise Manage added value and efficiency to our team
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
Connectwise Manage is an excellent PSA tool.  It would allow the techs and clients to easily communicate and have all the information saved within the tickets.  This feature also made it easy to track the time techs spent on tickets and quickly identify repeat issues due to the integration with Solarwins N-Able, our RMM tool.
The calendars within Manage were also great.  They allowed us to identify where the techs were in the event we needed to reroute them to an emergency.
Connectwise Manage also made billing a breeze.  The integration with some of our vendors as well as Quickbooks made billing our customers second nature.  Having the bills come from one provider rather than countelss different vendors really made reviewes quotes, bills and budgets significantly easier for our clients as well as our staff.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
There honestly was not much that I disliked about Connectwise Manage.  I think the product is excellent and their support knowledgeable and friendly as well.  If I had to make a suggestion, I would like to see a better Gantt feature.  When attempting to plan out projects, we would spend a significant amount of time in that section.

Recommendations to others considering ConnectWise PSA:
I would check the current products you are already using and see if they integrate with Connectwise Manage or know if it's in the road map.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
We utilized Connectwise Manage to clean up a lot of the noise from our RMM tool.  Instead of getting alerts to our phones and email constantly, we leveraged Conectwise Manage Service Boards as a silo for all of our tickets.  It made ticket tracking effortless.
We also would create boards for our partners that used us as suplemental IT.  This would allow us to transfer tickets to their internal IT staffs board.  Our clients that used this feature really enjoyed it.

all_reviews.review_title: Used to be a product we liked, Now its a product we dread
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
We like the features of ConnectWise and the integration's with other software package we use daily.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
I don't know where to start, but here we go. The customer service/support of ConnectWise has gone straight to the crapper since ConnectWise was sold, in the days of the older ownership, support was great, the product actually worked correctly. Now it takes a act of congress to get anything to happen and it takes a week or two to get anything resolved. We had issues where the ConnectWise mail filters have blocked our internal email and external for clients, to technicians not being able to submit time all because of changes these mental midget make to the systems and then they blame you for the mistakes they make. I've spent hours on the chat re inventing the wheel on our end, just to find out that the issues was inside their data base. We have technician in the field, ConnectWise does an update and none of our mobile apps work any longer, their solution just uninstall and re installed the app, it will fix it. Well, number one these are field technicians they don't typically have the time to do this during the field appointments. Number two, when they did this it didn't fix the issue and now we wait for the non existent support from ConnectWise. I could go on and on about the issues we have and have had with ConnectWise.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
Right now we are not solving any issues with ConnectWise that we couldn't get from another product, this is why we have already moved our RMM away from ConnectWise. But now it looks like we are going to have to move our PSA product as well.

all_reviews.review_title: Terrible customer service, crm system fails to deliver.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
The ability to see additional jobs created under a project

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
We are a home automation and low voltage company with multiple builders who have fixed spec projects and each individual contract calls for special pricing and special discounts. This system makes it terribly difficult to list the location where a product is to be installed. Other crm systems have the ability to annotate where items are to be installed for example DTools, or Service Fusion. CM progressive billing is not true profess I've invoicing. It doesn't function as progressive invoicing. New construction is impossible to track properly but the sales representative assured us this crm system would deliver on all our needs. All our questions during consultation were answered favorably and then after signing our agreement we found out the system was not able to function the way we were told it would. So there was no real transparency there. The representatives are just interested on sealing the deal with a term agreement for a crm that doesn't work as described. They will however promise that there's upcoming "enhancements" that would potentially fix the issues.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's created more problems instead of solving on multiple levels accounting and project tracking. We needed to add work around for the system to be usable. The end result is we needed to replace ConnectWise manage with a solution that would help streamline work orders and client notes for our business. I happened to learn that another company Sunbelt had similar horrid issues.... yet the company ConnectWise will not care about actually meeting expectations.

all_reviews.review_content:

The program does have the ability to store a large amount of data, and to sync with other calendars.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
The program is so outdated looking. Dysfunctional and cluttered. No way to update notes in real time on a task without creating a new entry every time. I could go on.

Recommendations to others considering ConnectWise PSA:
Try to shop around and see what similar programs will do what you need. If you decide on ConnectWize, I recommend to make use of the webinars and video lectures/tutorials they have available for the whole team to become efficient with the program.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use ConnectWise Manage to keep track of both current and upcoming tasks and their assigned engineers. The benefits are that we can use it with Quozal, and it is easy to sync with Google or Microsoft calendars.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
What I like best about ConnectWise manage is that it allows my team to have the needed info right at their finger tips. Also, since ConnectWise is purchasing so many other services, it makes integration very easy. When using ConnectWise Manage and Control, you can easily go from reading a tickets notes to connecting remotely to the machine in a few clicks.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
There are a few things that I dislike about ConnectWise Manage; first, it's pretty pricey when compared to other services, although ConnectWise manage is definitely more feature rich we may not use all of the services available. Also, every once and a while, the service will go down (since we're in the cloud) and cause weird issues like pages not loading or white screens; I will say that support is pretty top notch and most issues are resolved very quickly. Overall I'd say it's a great value.

Recommendations to others considering ConnectWise PSA:
I recommend taking the time to make sure Connectwise manage is configured CORRECTLY from the very beginning. We started using the software without really setting up and about a year after started running into major problems. Support was able to help get us working again but only after basically redoing all of the setup. When we asked what happened, our office manager at the time basically denied supports on-boarding assistance, so the error was definitely on our end.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use it for Ticket and time management; we also configure our clients info into ConnectWise Manage so they can access the built in customer portal which allows them to create and monitor their own tickets. It's basically an MSP's dream software with CRM built in!

You basically have an idea of how your workflow will be and connectwise can make it. As a systems administrator, I put all my time in there, all my notes, and it is great to refer back to what I was doing. We have synced all our alerts so every morning I check the alerts board to know what is happened. It is a great platform to have everything centralized in one space. One my responsibilities is QA and, with little information, you can find what you are looking for with ease.  The integration of ConnectWise with other products a huge benefit too.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
There is fair amount of maintenance with it to keep it updated.   The options for customization are so vast that it can be hard to know all the options available.  You almost have to approach it from the assumption that it CAN do the thing you want.  You just have to figure out how to do it.

Recommendations to others considering ConnectWise PSA:
It is a large task to move the ConnectWise platform and maintain it, but the benefits far outweigh the drawbacks.

I was not with my company when they adopted ConnectWise, but I can't imagine how we managed our ticket flow before.  With the vast amount of clients we have, and the multiple departments we have, ConnectWise allows us to easily navigate through both with ease.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
Connectwise Manage is a very feature complete tool. Handling of different boards and especially automation given in its workflows drives the backbone of our business everyday.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
Parent company Connectwise went on buying spree and has spent the last 5 years getting all of their products to get in-line with one another.
As a result there has been very little new features added in that time as they have mostly been focusing on getting all the products talking to one another.

It is probably the ugliest of all of the PSA products out there, but this has come a long way since we started using it as well - unfortunately how it looks is mostly the only changes.

Recommendations to others considering ConnectWise PSA:
ConnectWise is a big name in the space for good reason. If you are an MSP, this is a major piece of software to miss out on. The amount of companies out there collaborating with ConnectWise makes tying things in very easy and gives your employees a single place to operate out of.

all_reviews.review_title: ConnectWise a fabulous application for business
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
I am very useful using ConnectWise because it is designed so that companies can customize the functions to meet their needs. Being in IT, we can create multiple boards where we can block the permits only for certain departments, they can search for specific types of tickets. On the other hand, I can track the tickets with all their data, attachments and configurations.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
Although the application is extremely versatile, the interface is a bit old and some of the menu items can be confusing. Another problem is that software stability is often a calamity, with errors that cause problems when logging in or accessing systems The reports have a lot of information and the methods to recover it are unpleasant.

Recommendations to others considering ConnectWise PSA:
It is a perfect platform to track a large volume of tickets, purchase orders and inventory. It is very popular because it has the support of the community, various focused systems and designed to integrate natively. On the other hand, it offers a wide variety of functions of the company such as finance, marketing, sales, time tracking and a service desk so the whole team can use the same central system which is great.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
ConnectWise allows us to centrally process our clients, their assets, potential customers, service tickets and projects. Our schedules are also channeled through the application, so it is the main way in which employees can keep track of what everyone is working on. It is essential for everything we do as a company.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
You can track all your clients information and every single job you do for them. You can do quotes, send them, add providers to compare prices, manage the calendar of the employees, assign tickets to the correct person, there is nothing you can't do with this tool.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
inside all the greatness, there are some works around that you have to do for specific duties that could be automated.

Recommendations to others considering ConnectWise PSA:
Make sure you keep notes on each client profile, you can use the private note section, it is secure and it works as a reminder of everything you need to do about that specific client, only you and your employees will see those.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
it is easy to do all the work for each client from beginning to end, In the same tool, I can:
*Add a new client to the database
*Quote the job they request and send it by email so they can virtually approve it
*Check the calendar of my techs to assign the job to the correct person
*Leave notes and close the ticket
All that history stays in every single client profile which let me go back and track anything that I may need.

all_reviews.review_title: Great all round interface and system
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
What I like most about ConnectWise is the easy ability to navigate the system and how our employees who hardly touch it can still navigate and use it to record all the necessary information to bill our clients. We also use it for integrating with our Accounting and Sales software packages to use it for all aspects of the company.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
Reaching out to the chat option and having to wait for a Consultant to be assigned. Sometimes it is very quick, others it can take a while and sometimes I need an answer for upper management quicker than they respond. I also dislike that the report writer support is not included with the Manage monthly and quarterly payments. If you need assistance (which you probably will because it is quite a difficult feature) you have to pay.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
Timesheets, expense sheets, reporting. The benefits of ConnectWise are still being discovered every day, at the moment I am getting used to the reporting asking using the report writer (beware - they don't offer free support it is an additional cost)

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
The end of the ady when i can log out of Connectwise.
The Contract part is good.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
PRactically everything else:
Slow - keeps hanging when doing tasks such as save a ticket, send and invoice, close tickets - you know really important tasks which should be almost instant. absolute zero support from CW. Been told its a programming issue with bulk tasking and it will be fixed - still waiting, much like when using ConnectWise manage - always waiting.
Then there is the general support - lacking to say the least.
Then the onboarding - they say we get you completely up and running. What they should have said is You'll want to be running away by the time you come to use the product. Unless you learn it all in teh onboarding process your on your own or you have to pay a huge amount more for help. They literally just churn you out and get the next lot of sheep in.
Sales team lied about how it would interact and sync with Xero. Told me the same way as Quickbooks does and then showed me how Quickbooks Desktop syncs, saying just like this.... IT DOESNT you have to pay someone else to move your data from your PSA to your accounts package REALLY @ $245 extra per month. Didnt tell me that before i signed up.
Cloud console which was supposed to save time by syncronising Office 365 licenses to contracts was often wrong, very clunky and then stopped working - another paid feature of Connectwise that didnt work.
I could go on, but you get the picture. Its not all smooth sailing and is causing lots of issues in our business. We have tried to reach out to CW but they will not help unless we ay for Consultation. SHOCKING.

Recommendations to others considering ConnectWise PSA:
Really consider why you want to move to it.
Get demonstrations of a few products
Make a very clear list of things that you business needs to acheive with a PSA
Look around, get trials, DO NOT RUSH into it.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
None. We had a simple PSA / CRM in place. It just worked. I thought that as we grew we needed something to help us grow and mature - we didnt, we have wasted hundredds of hours on Connectwise - we could have spent that time with clients and building relationships to help our business grow and mature. Single worst decision we have made as a business. EVER.

all_reviews.review_title: Lots of functionality, but clunky program
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
It is an all-in-one tool for time tracking, expenses, billing, service desk/help desk (IT tickets), CRM, sales and marketing. It unifies our entire team into one system.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
I think the design of the system is clunky, and needs to be redesigned. The marketing features look promising, but really are quite cumbersome. It's not easy to do bulk adds or edits, so creating new contact groups and adding contacts is quite a chore. You must schedule emails at least 24 hours in advance because they must be reviewed by the connectwise team and be approved prior to being sent. They also add an unsubscribe header AND footer on emails based on a tiered scale of number of emails sent. The support team is nice and friendly, but it takes days to weeks to get resolutions or even acknowledgement about your issues. They do offer a chat function, which is hit or miss, depending on the rep and the issue. They are good at helping you find the documentation to help you through things though, or if you have a "How do I..." question they are good at answering those too.

Recommendations to others considering ConnectWise PSA:
If you're looking for an easy-to-use marketing tool for communications, campaigns and a CRM platform, I would keep looking.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
Time tracking, service desk tickets and sending quotes.

all_reviews.review_title: I don't love it, but it does have a lot of functions
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
It gives us a central location for contacts, quoting, service tickets, expenses and time entries, and marketing campaigns. Provides useful reports regarding sales opportunities, activities, forecasted sales, hours utilization, etc. The CW Campaigns offers good reporting for social media, including Facebook interactions (likes, loves, etc), which I haven't seen with other software programs before.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
It needs a face lift.. The UI is not attractive in my opinion. I do not find it an intuitive system to just pick up and learn. The Outlook calendar integration can get messy. I dislike the email builder template. It's clunky to create templates, and they require you to have an unsubscribe header and footer based on a tier of email sends. No other email management system I've used required an unsubscribe header. The entire campaign flow process is a bit clunky as you have to start with the calendar before you can create an email or social post.

Recommendations to others considering ConnectWise PSA:
Make sure it is setup correctly by a person or team that can dedicate time to understanding the system. This was implementing well before my time with the company, and it's my understanding that it was not set up right. We were unable to get good reports because we weren't using the system how it is designed to work. Overall, it's an effective system.

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
Storing company and contact information, tracking time to projects, and using it as a service help desk.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about ConnectWise PSA?
We use connectwise manage on a daily basis in our managed services department.  We use this to integrate with our alert and monitoring system LogicMonitor and we create tickets and manage tickets.  I like best that we can communicate to our customers right through our email connector and through the ticket itself.  I like the feature that when the customer responds that it bolds the ticket.

What do you dislike about ConnectWise PSA?
Least helpful is the fact that it is difficult to customize and use API calls on the back end to pull more data and make the tickets more automated and detailed. I also dislike the customer portal.  The customer portal needs it's UI updated with reports being fixed.  The customer needs to have more options available to them.

Recommendations to others considering ConnectWise PSA:
It is a good CRM/ helpdesk tool but if you want to do anything super complex with APIs, integration, and customization then I'd say sales force is the way to go . The Connectwise portal as well needs a revamp with more details/ options available to customers and they need to fix reporting

What problems is ConnectWise PSA solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are solving the issue of a ticket management system.  We are reminded about daily tasks and reports through ticket templates, we bill our customers based on what billable tickets are put in, we manage project tasks and assignments.
